description: Department of Defense Small Business Innovation Research Phase I (Air Force, Space Force)

technical_abstract.name: Technical Abstract
technical_abstract.guidelines: Write a 1-page technical abstract summarizing the innovation, technical approach, military relevance, and expected outcomes. Focus on how this addresses DoD mission needs.
technical_abstract.description: Technical summary of innovation and military applications

identification_and_significance.name: Identification and Significance of Problem
identification_and_significance.guidelines: Clearly identify the specific DoD problem or capability gap. Explain why current solutions are inadequate and why this innovation is significant for military operations. Reference specific DoD requirements, mission areas, or capability gaps.
identification_and_significance.description: Problem definition and significance to DoD mission

technical_objectives.name: Phase I Technical Objectives
technical_objectives.guidelines: Define specific, measurable Phase I technical objectives. Describe the technical approach, methodology, and proof-of-concept demonstrations. Include TRL advancement plan (typically TRL 3 to TRL 4-5). Address technical risks and mitigation strategies.
technical_objectives.description: Specific Phase I technical goals and approach

work_plan.name: Work Plan
work_plan.guidelines: Provide month-by-month work plan for 6-month Phase I. Include specific milestones, deliverables, performance metrics, and decision points. Show critical path and task dependencies. Align with DoD reporting requirements.
work_plan.description: Detailed work plan with timeline and milestones

related_work.name: Related Work
related_work.guidelines: Describe prior related work by the company and others. Explain how this proposal builds on or differs from existing solutions. Demonstrate awareness of competitive landscape and DoD existing capabilities.
related_work.description: Review of related work and competitive analysis

dual_use_applications.name: Dual Use and Commercialization
dual_use_applications.guidelines: Describe both military and commercial applications. Explain transition path to DoD acquisition programs (Phase III). Identify potential DoD customers and commercial markets. Include letters of support if available.
dual_use_applications.description: Military and commercial applications, transition strategy

company_capabilities.name: Company Capabilities and Experience
company_capabilities.guidelines: Describe company facilities, equipment, and relevant experience. Highlight prior DoD contracts or relevant projects. Demonstrate capability to execute Phase I and potential for Phase II/III.
company_capabilities.description: Company qualifications, facilities, and relevant experience

key_personnel.name: Key Personnel
key_personnel.guidelines: Provide brief biographies (1-page max each) for Principal Investigator and key personnel. Focus on relevant technical expertise and experience. Include security clearance status if applicable.

budget_justification.name: Cost Proposal and Budget Justification
budget_justification.guidelines: Detailed budget for up to $200,000 Phase I. Break down by: Direct Labor, Materials, Equipment, Travel, Consultants, Subcontractors, Other Direct Costs, Indirect Costs, Profit/Fee. Justify each line item with calculations and explanations. Must align with work plan.
budget_justification.description: Detailed cost proposal with line-item justifications

sub_criteria: Soundness and technical merit of proposed approach
Qualifications of proposed personnel and adequacy of available facilities
Feasibility of achieving Phase I technical objectives within 6 months
Realism of proposed costs in relation to proposed research
Adequacy of Phase I effort for Phase II

dod_relevance.description: Relevance to DoD mission and needs
sub_criteria: Potential contribution to DoD mission
Alignment with specific DoD requirements or capability gaps
Military utility and operational impact
Transition potential to DoD acquisition programs
Dual-use potential

commercialization.description: Commercial potential and Phase III path
sub_criteria: Potential for commercial success
Market size and opportunity
Company's commercialization plan and capability
Path to Phase III (DoD sales) and beyond
Dual-use applications
Qualifications of Principal Investigator
Company's relevant experience and past performance
Adequacy of facilities and equipment
Ability to execute and deliver results
Prior DoD contract performance if applicable

special_requirements.security_clearance: Not required for Phase I, may be needed for classified work
special_requirements.u.s._citizen_pi: Principal Investigator must be U.S. citizen
special_requirements.small_business_prime: Small business must be prime contractor
special_requirements.itar_compliance: May be required depending on topic

submission_requirements.pi_commitment: Minimum 20% time commitment during Phase I
